title: Quarterly Survey of Building Materials - Concrete Roofing Tiles

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

contents.description: This questionnaire has been designed for online mode. You may notice changes compared with the paper version, such as to the ordering of questions and sections.
There is additional guidance throughout the questionnaire. However, if you require support then please contact us on 0300 1234 931 or via email at surveys@ons.gov.uk

list: This voluntary survey is conducted by the Office for National Statistics on behalf of the Department for Business and Trade (DBT).
Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland unless otherwise stated.
This survey is to be completed for the sites named within the local unit list and new site list sections of this questionnaire.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

description.text: This survey collects information on your business's production and delivery of concrete roofing tiles as a building material during the quarter {ref_p_start_date} to {ref_p_end_date}.

contents.description: View more information about this survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
In this section you will be asked to provide the details of production for concrete roofing tiles.
This includes:

list: tiles manufactured
tiles delivered
closing stock
new works your business has brought into use since the date of your last return

contents.description: This section is to be completed for the sites named within the local unit list and new site list sections of this questionnaire.

In this section you will be presented with your business's local units that this return covers. You will be asked to check the list for any errors and provide details of any changes. If a unit is no longer covered by this return, include the date that it ceased production.
In this section you will be asked to provide details of any new sites that have come into production since your last return.
This includes:

list: name, address, and postcode of the new unit
nature of work carried on at the new unit
number of persons employed at the new unit
date the new unit came into production
DBT uses the information for monitoring trends in the construction industries.

For the benefit of industry, and the public generally, building materials information is published by DBT in their 'Monthly Statistics of Building Materials and Components' (this link opens in a new tab)

contents.description: You will be asked to provide the details of production for concrete roofing tiles.
This includes:

list: tiles manufactured
tiles delivered
closing stock
new works your business has brought into use since the date of your last return

contents.description: This section is to be completed for the sites named within the local unit list and new site list sections of this questionnaire.

title.text: For the period {ref_p_start_date} to {ref_p_end_date}, how many square metres of concrete roofing tiles were manufactured by {ru_name}?

description:
Record in square metres of roof area covered.

1 square yard = 0.836 square metres.

Informed estimates are acceptable.

If the value is known to be none, enter a single zero.

contents.description: This refers to products completed and ready for despatch.

answers.label: Concrete roofing tiles manufactured
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest whole number. For example, for 0.836 square metres, enter 1 square metre.

question.title: For the reporting period, how many square metres of concrete roofing tiles were delivered by your business?
description:
Record in square metres of roof area covered.

1 square yard = 0.836 square metres.

Informed estimates are acceptable.

If the value is known to be none, enter a single zero.

contents.description: This refers to products which have actually left the premises.

answers.label: Concrete roofing tiles delivered
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest whole number. For example, for 0.836 square metres, enter 1 square metre.

title.text: How many square metres of concrete roofing tiles were in your business's closing stock on {ref_p_end_date}?

description:
Record in square metres of roof area covered.

1 square yard = 0.836 square metres.

Informed estimates are acceptable.

If the value is known to be none, enter a single zero.

answers.label: Closing stock of concrete roofing tiles
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest whole number. For example, for 0.836 square metres, enter 1 square metre.

blocks.page_title: Closing stock of concrete roofing tiles

answers.label: New works brought into use since the date of your last return

contents.description: In this section you will presented with your business's local units that this return covers. You will be asked to check this list for any errors and provide details of any changes. If a unit is no longer covered by this return, include the date that it ceased production.

question.title: The following local units are covered by this return. Check this list for any errors and provide details of any changes.

contents.description: Include:

list: if the unit is no longer covered by this return, with the date that it ceased production

contents.description: Exclude:

list: any new sites. You can provide these in the 'new site list' section in this questionnaire

items.title: What is the name, address, and postcode of the new unit?

question.title: Please provide any further details that will help us understand your figures and to tell an industry story
description: Make sure you continue to the next page and select 'submit answers' at the bottom.

contents.description: Include:

list: comments on figures included in this return, for example, to explain any substantial fluctuations in your figures compared with those of the previous return
any additional information about your business's local units
